Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to Appear for a Visa Interview
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether Toni Nawfal was a 'dependent child' under section 2 of the Regulations
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, SOR/2002-227
Crimes.Application_Facts: Conflicting testimonies about Toni Nawfal's dependency; prior statements indicated independence
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: IAD concluded Toni Nawfal was not a dependent child
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Applicant for permanent residence as dependent child
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Failed to appear for visa interview
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Disputed dependency status due to alleged physical condition
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Credibility of testimony regarding financial dependence
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, SOR/2002-227, section 2
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Inconsistencies between current and prior testimonies undermined credibility
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Prior application records, testimonies on financial support and living arrangements
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 2 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Application_Basis: Claim of dependency due to physical or mental condition
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Overturn IAD decision and allow permanent residence application
Crimes.Governing_Rule: A dependent child over 22 must substantially depend on parental financial support due to a physical or mental condition
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of consistent evidence supporting ongoing dependency
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential undermining of immigration system integrity if false dependency claims are accepted
Crimes.Cause_Description: Conflicting testimonies regarding Toni Nawfal's dependency status led to credibility concerns
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: IAD compared prior and current testimonies to assess consistency
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 2 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Failure to meet eligibility criteria for permanent residency as dependent
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 2, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Emphasis on consistency and credibility of dependency claims
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Inconsistencies in testimony rendered claim unreasonable
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Discrepancies in self-reported independence vs. claimed dependency

Crimes.Crime_Name: False or Misleading Information in an Application under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether IAD erred in finding Toni Nawfal not a dependent child
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Appeal from IAD decision on dependency claim
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Testimonies contradicted prior statements indicating independence
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 2 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Claimed dependency due to handicap despite past independence
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Credibility of applicant based on inconsistent statements
Crimes.Application_Factor: Age over 22 with claimed physical dependency
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies between current claims and past representations
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Right to appeal and fair hearing granted
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Not applicable – no forged documents, but misleading information
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Central to determination due to conflicting accounts
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to IAD’s interpretation of dependency
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of administrative tribunal decision
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose prior assertions of independence
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Misrepresentation of material facts in application

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether Toni Nawfal qualified as a dependent child under section 2
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Appeal against refusal of permanent residence
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Contradictions between current dependency claim and past independence
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Prior application records, testimonies on living and financial arrangements
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Claim of dependency due to physical disability
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Administrative appeal followed by judicial review
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: Section 2 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Application_Error: Presenting conflicting information about dependency status
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decisions
Crimes.Application_Factor: Applicant over 22 claiming dependency due to handicap
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether IAD reasonably assessed credibility and dependency
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Definition of dependent child under section 2
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Inconsistent evidence regarding financial and personal independence
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Appellant had opportunity to present case
Crimes.Document_Fraud: No forged documents, but false or misleading statements
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Central issue due to contradiction in narratives
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Argument that IAD misinterpreted dependency criteria
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to reconcile prior declarations of independence
